caption.p: Schematic representation of the main mechanisms exploited by bacteria to tackle the action of antibiotics. (A) The inactivation of the drug by its hydrolysis or structural modification. (B) The prevention of the access to the target by reducing membrane permeability or overexpression of efflux pumps. (C) Changes in the antibiotic targets by mutation or post-translational modifications. (D) Resistance mechanism of Mycobacterium tuberculosis to isoniazid drug mutations in the katG gene causes the accumulation of the inactive form of the antibiotic inside the bacilli without the formation of active adduct.
